result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy G. Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Def. re: sit time on all cases with FTP/Huber alternate

The Court orders that: Upon deposit of $100.00, the Failure to Pay commitment shall be canceled.  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance, plus interest and a $15.00 payment plan fee, at the rate of $25.00/mo., commencing 03/01/2016. 25% annual increase of monthly payment shall be implemented. The civil judgment and referral to the WI DOR, if applicable, shall remain.  ANy failure to comply with this payment order shall result in the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing.

Case called at 8:11 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Timothy G. Roberts not in court. No other appearances.
Court refviews case file documents, indicates that notice was sent to Mr. Roberts at his last known address & it was not returned as underliverable. Case is in post-conviction status, matter was set upon Mr. Roberts request for relief from payment plan. Given non-appearance, Court denies relief & concludes that if Mr. Roberts had true need he would have appeared. Any future requests for relief are denied - Court orders bookkeepers to be notified of this and if Mr. Roberts defaults on payment plan, then the alternate shall be imposed. 
Recess: 8:14 am Reconvene: 8:15 am 
Court reviews conflict review worksheet prepared by Court's JA
Court has done required analysis, finds there is no reason to disqualify or recuse in the past, so there is need to recuse or disqualify in the present
Recess: 8:17 am
Payment hearing at 11-24-2015 08:10 am
Payplan in Br 3 case is temporarily suspended until the payment hearing.
Letter from the defendant ref payment plan

with criminal case settlement & elements

Cases 15CM49 and 15CM51 called together at 2:53pm [mo]
Defendant Timothy G. Roberts in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Case 15CM51; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, The Court reads in and dismisses Case 15CM49

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Roberts

On Case 15CM51 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 5  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on   July 10, 2015 at 
6:00pm
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 8/17/15 and on the 17th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a   8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess: 3:12pm

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy G. Roberts
Current: N6895 N. Island View Rd, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 03-16-2015)
Prior: 300 N. Fourth St., Apt 8, Watertown, WI 53094
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

cases #15CM49 and #15CM51 called at 3:43pm. [MK]
Defendant Timothy G. Roberts appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail in court, in custody.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Roberts indicates that he has not received the Criminal Complaints in these cases.  
recess 3:44pm (for Mr. Roberts to receive copies of the Criminal Complaints and read them). 
reconvene 3:55pm.   
Mr. Roberts indicates that he no longer resides at the apartment address on the Criminal Complaints, however he intends to pursue re-renting that apartment upon release from incarceration. 
Service of Complaints admitted, the charges and maximum penalties are recited; the reading of the factual portions of the Complaints is waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in each Criminal Complaint. 
Mr. Roberts verifies that he heard the Court provide information on right to counsel, and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given
.
After Mr. Roberts indicates that he intends to apply for PD counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

During the discussion regarding bond, Mr. Roberts requests to sign his bond right before his release because he believes he may receive credit for the time he is now serving at jail on an OWI 3rd sentence. 
The Court requires $500 signature bond [which applies to both cases], with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
--this bond is to be available at the Jail for Mr. Roberts to sign at any time before his release from incarceration 
recess 4:07pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on both cases on 3/31/15 at 2:00pm. (Mr. Roberts anticipates release from the Jail on March 15th)
